item.description:
From the co-creators of Secret Hitler & Better Myths: a Blade Runner-inspired, five-minute party game for two players.

Inhuman Conditions is a five-minute, two-player game of surreal interrogation and conversational judo, set in the heart of a chilling bureaucracy.

Each game has one Investigator and one Suspect. Armed only with two stamps and a topic of conversation, the Investigator must figure out whether the Suspect is a Human or a Robot.

Robots must answer the Investigator's questions without arousing suspicion, but are hampered by some specific malfunction in their ability to converse. They must be clever, guiding the conversation in subtle ways without getting caught.

Humans may speak freely, but may find this freedom as much curse as gift. There are no right or wrong answers, only suspicious and innocuous ones, and one slip of the tongue could land Humans and Robots alike in the Bureau's Invasive Confirmation Unit. There, alongside Investigators who make improper determinations, they will await further testing ...

—description from the publisher

Sit down and grab a glass because here comes a story...

You've plundered the dungeon and come away with a solid and heavy treasure chest. After struggling to break the lock, to everyone's surprise, the chest was full of...potions! In Brewitched, you are adventurers sharing and tasting unknown potions to discover which ones are the most powerful (and valuable).

Spend your action points to smell, switch, drink, and throw away a potion or use one of the eight characters' special abilities. But be careful! Some of the potions are cursed, and this curse will be represented in real life... The results will be hilarious!

A DRINKING GAME (OR NOT)
Fun with or without drinks!
Play with younger players or designated drivers.

item.description:
The original city-building game Big City returns to print in a 20th Anniversary Jumbo Edition with buildings 33% larger than the original game and revised property trading rules.

In Big City, players acquire cards in eight different neighborhoods, then use them to lay out buildings either one, two, or three spaces large. The points they receive for a given building is a base score, plus bonuses for the buildings surrounding it. Someone must play city hall (scoring no points for themselves) in order for anyone to start placing any structure beyond the simple residences and business. As for what differs from the original game in this new edition:

• Redevelopment Phase - This new mandatory phase happens at the end of each round of player turns (i.e. after all players have acted). In point order (first to last) each player must surrender one property from their hand, and optionally they can surrender a second property. Then in reverse point order, each player takes back a number of cards equal to the number they surrendered. Cards are normally played face-down so that only the neighborhood is visible. However, a player can "jump to the front of the line" by choosing to play their card face-up. However, this can be done only when the card is currently usable, so you cannot use this method if you're trying to trade neighborhood properties which are not yet in play. (You can still trade them, just face-down only.)

This redevelopment phase helps to solve the stand-off issue in which players are tempted to hoard properties when the person owning the neighboring property was also doing the same thing. Now the city enforces a "use it or lose it" policy.

• Escalating City Hall Points - City Hall starts the game worth 0 points, but each round it escalates by 1 point up to a maximum of 5.

• Early Game End - If everyone passes or uses the exchange action, the game ends immediately. That means there is no guarantee your city will become a Big City. Be very sure not to leave the leader in control of the last downtown property before City Hall is built!

• Base Game 2-4 players only - The original edition allowed up to 5 players, but this was widely-considered to be too many players because such a large proportion of neighborhoods started the game on the board and the action became crowded in a hurry. As per Benno's request, the base game is now just 2-4.

• New Waterfront Tile - Basically it's a neighborhood where nothing can be built. It acts as both a barrier to adjoining neighborhood placement, but also it provides a bonus to residential placed nearby.

item.description:
Mine Carts is a game in which the players together explore an abandoned mine, looking for precious ores!

The abandoned mine is represented by a six by six grid on a board. The players start with two player figures each at the edges and take turns placing square tiles with tracks leading into the mine. They follow the tracks and may stumble upon ore deposits when doing so. Mining an ore deposit yields an ore token that may be more or less valuable.

Throughout the game, players will find themselves colliding with other players. Players that collide will loose their player figures and will, when no player figures remain, be eliminated from the game. However, eliminated players haven't automatically lost the game. They may still win, granted that they managed to collect the most precious ores before being eliminated!

Clever players may find ways to mine the ore deposits while also eliminating other players!

—description from the designer

Once upon a time, there’s was kingdom nobody knows. Everybody wanted to marry the young, wise, beautiful princess, even though they knew she could be troublesome sometimes. One day the princess said “The man who brings me a handful of these flowers will be my husband”. The “task” the princess proposed wasn’t easy at all for the flower she named was “Gem Flower” which can only be raised in dead-cold weather. Now the battle of suitors has begun.

You’re one of the suitors who gained relative’s support to acquire “Gem Flower”. You are in the coldest county of the nation where you can find “Gem Seeds”. Whoever gathered enough seeds to obtain 2 Flowers(20 Seeds) is the winner.

Players put one of the cards they have face down to determine “Sunity”(The higher the number, the more sun you see) each round. There are numbers from 1 to 50. The “Sunity” will determine which regions will be hit by blizzards. One of the numbers played this round will become current “Sunity”.
Once all players played their cards, each player guess current “Sunity” and move one of their player tokens to a region on the game board.

The numbers (10~40) shown on the game board is the required Sunity in order to receive reward from that particular region. The regions with the numbers less than equal to Sunity will be hit by a blizzard. When everyone moved their player tokens, turn all the played cards face up and determine Sunity.

All the player tokens that were hit by blizzards will be removed from the game board and sent back to their hometowns. Players will receive rewards from each player tokens remained on the game board. The number +1~+4 shows how many seeds you can receive from each region.

Avoid blizzards by figuring out Sunity and become the first one to acquire Gem Flower!

Interference! is a game in which two players attempt to save the world from utter destruction.

You are the operators of a missile control mainframe and due to a slight human error, the total annihilation of the world is looming! The systems have locked you out and you can only rely on your hacking skills to regain control.

The mainframe's lock is represented by four double-sided cards that are shared between the two players. Both players hold a hand of secret action cards as well as a card showing a secret target sequence.

Using their action cards, the players struggle to change the lock sequence into their target sequence. This will break a layer of the mainframe's security system and help the players regain control.

Will the two players prevail and save the world or should we all seek immediate shelter? The fate of the world is in your hands!

—description from the designer

In 7 for the Queen, players compete to create a new necklace for the Queen, but it is not easy to meet her ever-changing needs and desires, and they have to ensure they have the right combination when the Queen finally decides what she wants.

7 for the Queen won the annual "Best Unpublished Game" competition sponsored by dV Giochi and Lucca Comics and Games, and this limited edition of the game is part of the reward.

item.description:
The elements have become misaligned and are causing all sorts of trouble in the world. Severe drought, hurricane after hurricane and yet another super hero movie that no one asked for are just some of the plagues the world has had to live through. In Prima Materia, the players struggle to align the elements in an effort to make all things good again.

The elements are represented by sixteen double-sided cards showing one of the four classical elements on each side. These cards are arranged in a grid of four by four cards. Each player holds a secret hand of action cards as well as a card with a secret target sequence. The players use their action cards to change the elemental cards and gain points for each sequence they manage to form.

Will the elements realign and introduce stability in the world? Or will we face a future of starvation, war and reggaeton music?

—description from the designer

Why go to the same boring job every day in order to receive a steady and predictable income when you can start working in the gig economy? The gig economy allows you to get all of the drawbacks and none of the benefits while struggling to make ends meet.

In Home Delivery, the players take on work as traveling popsicle sellers. The players take turns placing rectangular city tiles forming the road network of the city. In some parts of the city, there lives popsicle-craving residents with very specific tastes. They will gladly purchase a popsicle but it will have to be of the correct flavor.

Each player can take on tasks from the local ice cream parlors, delivering a set of popsicles to the residents. For every task that a player completes, they are awarded with a small paycheck. The players may save their paychecks to pay for things like rent and food or may use their pay to gain a competitive advantage over their fellow popsicle sellers.

Have you ever dreamt of owning your very own ice cream truck? Well forget about that. You're part of generation rent and this is the gig economy so all you can afford is to rent one and hope that your investment pays off!

So what are you waiting for? Quit your day job and become part of the new economy. It's gonna be huge.

—description from the designer

In Homebrew: The Potion Brewing Game, the players venture down into the haunted basement of their house. The players are attempting to brew magic potions and need to find the correct ingredients, but someone has left the basement in a terrible mess!

In every room of the basement, one of six different magic ingredients is to be found. The players each hold secret recipe cards and take turns exploring the basement by placing new rooms next to the existing ones.

When a player manages to find the ingredients required to brew their special magic potion, they gain a point. The player having brewed the most potions when the basement is fully explored becomes the potion master and wins the game!

—description from the designer

User summary
BodoCa is short for 'Board Game's Card Game'. It is a Japanese card game with only Japanese text on the cards, so is very language dependent as is.

BodoCa is a party trivia card game about board games. The cards contain board game attributes such as theme, component, or designer. There are two play styles: expert and family.

For the family game, the game flow is similar to 20 questions. Each player, except the leader, has a hand of ten cards. The leader thinks of a game, then the players use their cards to narrow down the title. The person who guesses correctly wins the round.

For the expert game style, players are dealt a hand of cards, then each play one card. Players then try to come up with games that fit the criteria described by the cards in play.

link.value: Colorful Spiele (カラフルシュピーレ)

item.description:
Making sweet combinations can be such a blast! In Sugar Blast, you try to make connections between same-colored candies to create blasts! You must swap out two adjacent candies to make a string of three or more of the same type. Then, you remove the matched candies and adjust the unique tilting board so that candies slide down to fill in the missing spaces. Finally, you fill in candies at the top from ones chosen randomly from the bag. The bigger the blast you create, the more candies you earn.

You are going to try to make big moves, but must be careful not to leave valuable opportunities for your opponents. Everyone is in a race to collect candies and complete the objective card. The first one to collect the necessary candies will earn a sweet victory!

—description from the publisher

item.description:
This is a game that simulates the battles of Pilo and Sfacteria during the Peloponnesian War.

It is a new edition of SphactÃ©rie (425 av. J.-C.) published in Vae Victis 95.

Egemonia simulates the Peloponnesian War between Sparta and Athens in ancient Greece. Each player represent one of these two important cities and will try to orientate as much areas as possible to its side. 
The focus is on influence rather than on real wargaming.
In Vertical, you play a mountaineer on an evolving, demanding cliff face, competing against ruthless competitors to climb, which will be a problem since you've forgotten some of your equipment...
Clash with your opponents on a trail full of pitfalls. In Car Clash, you build your track, construct your vehicle, and face your opponents throughout a thrilling race.

item.description: The Parisian metro is a true labyrinth. In Metro, you must assemble your metro line and be the first to reach your destination, taking as few connections as possible.

name.value: Last Full Measure: The Battle of Brandy Station

item.description:
In June of 1863 Alfred Pleasonton and the cavalry of the Army of the Potomac would face J.E.B. Stuart's cavalry of the Army of Northern Virginia near Culpepper Virginia in what would be the largest cavalry battle in North America.

Last Full Measure is a free print-and-play game system of battles of the American Civil War. Brandy Station is the seventh game in the series.

A brigade scale game that uses regiment counters, as opposed to generic line markers, to spread the brigade over multiple hexes according to its size. Ranged artillery fire, cavalry charges, command and control, all in only eight pages of rules. Play aids include Player-aid card with CRT and other charts and table; Eliminated Units card, Order of Arrival card, and 272 2-sided counters.

The Battle Book includes two Scenarios; Groveton, August 28th: The Full Battle and Longstreet Arrives, August 29th and an initial strength chart.

The map measures 39" x 35" at a scale of 250 yard per 3/4" hex.
AND just added (July 25, 2018), a 21" x 35" map extension to the west with a new Order of Arrival card to accommodate the new map.
A new ZunTzu box also incorporates the new map extension.

The full game is available for download at: http://todd.mainecav.org/lfm/
as are Zun Tzu gameboxes for all LFM games

name.value: ひどらのしょうもうせん (Hydra's War of Attrition)

item.description:
ã²ã©ã‚‰ã®ã—ã‚‡ã†ã‚‚ã†ã›ã‚“ (Hitora no Shousen) Hydra's War of Attrition is a Japanese 2 player abstract game with a horror theme.

Translated from the rules
"There are small hydras which inhabit a dangerous land full of evil spirits. They sluggishly move back and forth, sometimes running across one another. When that happens, they battle to the death."

User description
Each player places a trio of hydra tokens (Majoritei, Arakure, and Fushigi) on marked spaces along the edge of the board. A turn then consists of the following steps: Multiplying the Majoritei, moving a hydra, and possibly removing opposing hydra pieces.

Players start by taking a Majoritei hydra from their supply and placing it next to another one already on the board. They then choose one of their hydra to move. Finally, if they've surrounded an opponent's hydra and at least one of their surrounding hyrda is on a nest of evil spirits, they capture their opponent's piece and return their piece from the nest to their supply.

These steps are repeated until one player can either form a line using six of their hydra, or until all of a player's hydra are captured.

Company level American Revolution wargame rules.

A5 Booklet of 51 pages, plus the 4-page Card Playsheets in the centre of the booklet.

These rules carry on from 'Ranger', used for the French-Indian Wars and have similar sections to 'File Leader', again by Pete Berry. Players who have played either of these two games will be familiar with the rules system.

Standard D6 used throughout.

In Race to Space, players embark on an epic battle of wits earning points and game advantages by completing mission quests. Avoid treacherous sabotages, swaps, steals and other shenanigans while navigating through mini games such as Rock-Paper-Scissors duels, instant win chances, and dice challenges. Blast off with this Space Age game designed to re-define learning as an out of this world experience! Finally, a game for kids who wish learning was fun!

You are a squad commander in charge of eight spaceships and five battle rings. A meteor has destroyed your planet, and you are searching for a new home. You are now in a race to capture two of the three remaining big planets to rule the galaxy. But beware you have an enemy with the same mission.

To win this intergalactic Orbit Battle, you need to use all your skill to outmaneuver your enemy and capture the planets.

The object of the game is to be the first player to capture two of the three big planets with three spaceships on each of the big planets. The first player who has invaded a big planet with three spaceships has captured that planet. When a player has invaded the big planet with three spaceships, the other player cannot enter this planet anymore.

item.description:
Ojczysty ("Native") is a party game in which Polish language will surprise you with its wealth. More than hundred unusual words. Their meanings are explained on the cards. One of the six words on the board will be your hidden goal. Your task is to guess it with the help of clue cards provided by another player. Will you risk betting only one answer...?
 
The game was published as part of the social and educational campaign "Native - add to favorites", run by the National Center for Culture since 2012. Its aim is to shape the linguistic awareness of Poles and to promote care for the correctness of the Polish language.

—description from the designer

Pestka, drops, cukierek is a kid's journey to the world of economics. The game presents the basic mechanisms of demand and supply in an accessible way, and at the same time it tells an extraordinary story of a mysterious land hidden in Julek's pocket. The evil king forbids everything that gives joy, health and happiness! Your task is to make the magical land be vibrant again. But you must hurry - the evil king raises funds to pay for the army, which is to punish the rebel residents. The fate of the kingdom is in your hands!

The game was created on the basis of a book by one of the most valued Polish writers for children - Grzegorz Kasdepke.

Gameplay:
There are 7 action fields on the board. In your turn, you can move to any field in a clockwise direction (Players themselves choose how many squares they will move their pawn. But the consequence of this quick free access to various actions is the increasing frequency of paying tribute to the king.) On the action field, a player can perform the appropriate action: draw resources, change them into "goods" (for example a pencil into a picture), sell "goods" to inhabitants of gray houses or exchange resources. After each action, active player asks others if they want to pay him 1 coin to do the same action in a limited way.

The game may end in two ways: When the number of gray houses is smaller than the number of players - then the player with the most coins is the winner; When the royal treasury is full, then everybody lose.

—description from the designer

DisgRace To The White House is a fast-paced, strategic, and satirical board game for energized progressives everywhere. In between protesting, marching, and crying into your pillow--why not laugh too? DisgRace To The White House provides catharsis and the roadmap to resistance during these trying, rights-depleted, tiny-hands times. Players brush up on America's horribly archaic Electoral College system as well as DJT's certifiably insane Tweets, as they navigate the election in a race to the White House.

While battling for electoral votes, players impersonate Trump's "unique" form of verbal diarrhea, quote mind-bending Tweets, and pick up "Disaster" Cards, all in the name of winning the oval office through alternative facts. Interactive, team-building and generally outrageous, players shriek, squeal, and laugh--all at the same time. Gameplay constantly shifts until a winner is crowned (poor choice of words). You're never assured of victory until the bitter end (sorry "Haters and Losers!"). A perfect gift--play it around the trashcan fire when the Trumpocalypse finally comes!

—description from the designers

Four in a row wins!

This victory condition is well known, but Ringo puts a new twist on the concept. The playing field consists of eight rings: four red and four blue. On a turn, the active player places a disc of their color in any ring, then moves the ring to a position adjacent to another ring. Whoever first creates a row of four discs or four rings in their color wins!

item.description:
The goal of Takla sounds simple: Place wooden blocks to create a structure that touches the red ball in the center of the playing area.

The challenge, though, comes from where you start building and where the ball is located. The ball is on a column, and you can place it as high or as low as you want, with more height equalling a greater challenge. Each of the 2-4 players starts building at a certain mark away from the column, although you could handicap some players by starting them further back. You need to stack the wooden blocks to create a floating one-ended bridge, a bridge that reaches out toward the ball and ideally doesn't collapse under its own weight or unbalanced nature.

You can play a real-time game in which whoever touches the ball first wins, a pauper's game in which whoever uses the fewest pieces wins, or a turn-based game in which players place blocks one by one.

Zwoggels are cute little creatures who live under stones, but nobody wants to encounter them three times. Why? Because then you have to take home one of the three, and whoever does this three times is eliminated — from the game, that is.

Gameplay in Zwoggel is simple: Flip two tiles face up, then place three new tiles face down and hope someone else falls into your trap. If you reveal three zwoggels of the same color in a row, then you have to take one home. Hope you can avoid finding more in the future...

Mechanisms is a game of mechanisms.

To play, deal each player 3 Mechanism Cards and place the included hodgepodge of components within reach of everyone on a table. The first clue-giver is the person who most recently posted a comment on BoardGameGeek.

Starting with the first clue-giver, then clockwise, each clue-giver has 30 seconds to silently use the components on the table (as well as fellow players) as props to get someone to guess 2 of their Mechanism Cards. Clue-givers are encouraged to pair the mechanisms in a set of seemingly seamless actions as if they were playing a game with all mechanisms present. The guesser(s) gets the correctly guessed Mechanism Card as a point and the clue-giver gets the third Mechanism Card as a point if 2 mechanisms are guessed.

After everyone has had a turn, shuffle all non-point Mechanism cards and deal 2 new Mechanism cards to each player, continuing the game.

The player who collects 5 Mechanisms first this way, wins! As a finale, feel free to pitch a fun, creative, and unique game idea using all of your mechanism point cards!

—description from the designer

item.description:
Is being a parent easy? Are your feelings of anxiety trolling you? If only life had some uncomplicated way to explain everything, like it used to be when all we had to worry about was our ABC's.

Parenting is Easy is a casual board game for 2 to 4 players, meant for high strung adults, hyperactive kids, or anyone in between. Quick and easy to learn, everyone's goal is to drive their parents completely insane by causing as much chaos as possible in their family home.

item.description:
Magnio consists of unique and mesmerizing pieces that push, pull and shoot on each other - with the power of magnetism. Similar to a deck of cards, you’re not limited to a single game. You'll find several fun and attractive games in the box, but you will soon find yourself experimenting and playing with the pieces freehand. Now you'll be able to create your very own games, expanding the possibility of Magnio even further!

Magnetic air-hockey? No problem!

Magnetic curling? Create it!

It's a game designed for those that desire to think outside the box, or just want to casually play some magnetic dexterity action!

You're invited to explore the possibilities with hands-on demonstrations of physics and fun. Push, pull, and shoot magnets with other magnets as you manipulate the set. Create structures and sculptures, test your skills, create new games, and find even more ways to play. However you decide to use them, we're positive you'll enjoy the experience of Magination.

In this little card game you are trying to capture magical creature named Lirog. This old and powerfull but not too smart being, has something priceless in his posession. As one of the wizards you are trying to lure him into the trap using spells and forest fruits. In the deck there are 12 kind of cards with distiguish powers. Every player is trying to program the game area, so that after activation, Lirog will enter their trap.

There are only 52 cards in the deck. At the start of the game players recive 3 random cards each. In a specified order they can put one card on the game board and take 1 card from the market or take 2 cards from the market. After all players finished their turns, creature will make his moves. Depending on cards that affect him, he will move around the game board. If during move phase Lirog enters one of the traps, the game ends. Owner of that trap becomes the winner.

—description from the publisher

Minicity, the funnest game to learn English with friends. Explore this coloring and exciting city full of surprises!

It consists of a colorful and vibrant circular board where you can move from the launch of a dice. Players start at the Bank, then passing through different places and stores in the miniature city. They can buy all the places and adding workers and products related to every place or shop. And all in English!

Every time players stop at the social media icons, they receive “social media messages” through the messages cards and get ready for different surprises and actions to do at MiniCity. They can be lucky, or not so much!

Players can role play to “work” as a bank teller or a realtor while playing. Also, they can use Minicity cars and taxi, if getting some of the lucky messages.

The player with the most places and most money at the end of the game will be the winner.

Untamed: Feral Factions is a fast-paced shuffle-building card battle game. Players each take control of three animal factions that battle together to bring down the opponent's three Strongholds. Each faction has its own unique appearance, Stronghold, and play style. By combining three different factions each game, players will be able to discover new synergies, combos and strategies.

The game features a streamlined ruleset, a double resource system that adds tactical depth and emphasises quick, 30 minute play sessions. Players can easily build their decks at the start of the game by choosing three animal factions: shuffle them together and you are ready to play.

Each turn a player will face interesting choices with regards to how to use their cards: all cards double as resources which are required to play Animals and Items. Previously used and defeated cards enter a player's Support Area where they can be used to fuel powerful card abilities.

Untamed: Feral Factions requires no additional purchases beyond the base set for an optimal playing experience, with almost seven hundred possible deck combinations out of the box.

The game is scheduled for a Q2 2019 Kickstarter launch.

item.description:
The forgotten creatures of the forest have awoken from their slumber and nobody knows for sure what is lurking in the Iron Valley. You followed the call of your king. Now it is time for heroic deeds in The Boldest!


Defeat mechanical monsters, retrieve enigmatic artifacts, use helpful items and lead your faction to glory. Each round, three expedition leave into the unknown to explore this mysterious place. You form three groups, one for each expedition, with the heroes in your hand. Only the strongest groups can take part in an expedition, so you need to apportion your power. Can you read your opponents well enough and forestall them? Collect the most experience and become a legend! Are you worthy of the title “The Boldest”?

 
Max Prentis passionately created and illustrated the world of The Boldest. His love for details can be found on every card. The over 100 unique Illustrations let you delve into this rich world. Get ready to explore!
 Those of you who are curious and want a glimpse at the game mechanics are in luck because we want to give you a peak under the hood for the new, second game by Sophia Wagner (Noria was her first).
 The core mechanics of The Boldest are Hand Management, Programming and Hidden Bidding. 
Each player starts with a Faction consisting of 17 Starting Heroes from the 5 Classes (3 Warriors, 3 Technicians, 3 Hunters, 5 Cooks and 3 Pets).
 In the Planning Phase you secretly form three Groups with Heroes of the same Class behind your Screen and place them face down one Group per Planning Space.
Every Hero executes a different Action in the following Action Phase but in general they let you take specific Forest Cards or new Heroes. 
Pets are the only exception they can be combined with any other Class. Why is that important?
 Because in the Action Phase only the strongest Groups can execute their Classes action. 
The Planning Spaces are resolved consecutively. First all players reveal their Group in Planning Space 1 and tell the other players the Class they played and the Group Strength (defined by the number of Class icons on the played cards). The strongest Group executes their action and afterwards sends their Leader to the king (this Hero is out of the game) while the remaining Heroes celebrate their success in the Party Tent. 
They won’t be available next round to that player. Weaker Groups keep their Heroes and get a new one as compensation.

As mentioned before, the Classes execute different Actions in a specific order: Warriors always go first followed by Technicians, Hunters and Cooks. The Cooks convince new Heroes with Special Abilities to join your Faction with their delicious dishes. The Warriors, Technicians and Hunters can take specific Forest Cards while other cards block their way. How the Forest changes over the course of three Expeditions of a round is also something you must anticipate during the Planning Phase. In the Action Phase you cannot change your Groups anymore.

After 5 or 6 rounds (depending on the number of players) the player who was able to collect the most experience will be known as "The Boldest"!

—description from the publisher

name.value: Fugue: A Psychogenic Game Of Creation

item.description:
Fugue: A Psychogenic Game of Creation, is a game of creation and manipulation. You and your opponents are opposing creative forces inside an Artist’s mind. Whether the Artist is a painter, poet, musician, or something else, they’re struggling to create a work, and you must make sure the best ideas win out—yours. You will battle by manipulating the Artist’s Spirit, Imagination, Vision, Depth and Passion into sets of two cards, and by creating Fugues.

By using these card sets and Fugues, you will move cards from one area of the Artist’s mind to another, and into your Passion area where they are scored.

Your opponent will be trying to move their cards as well, and you must keep that from happening.

Fugue is a quick-paced strategy game for one to two (*or more) players.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Don't let this little box fool you...it's stuffed with tons of interesting trivia questions that'll have you thinking, laughing, and wracking your brains!

Put on your smarty pants and have a ball! Play for hours & collect 'em all!

This cute little box contains a game board, 4 pawns, a die, 500 questions on cards, rules, and unquantifiable fun. Seriously.

—description from the box

Don't let this little box fool you...it's stuffed with tons of interesting trivia questions that'll have you thinking, laughing, and wracking your brains!

Put on your smarty pants and have a ball! Play for hours & collect 'em all!

This cute little box contains a game board, 4 pawns, a die, 500 questions on cards, rules, and unquantifiable fun. Seriously.

—description from the box

name.value: Drinking Games for People Who Never Drink Except When They Do

item.description:
A collection of 50 drinking games broken into six different categories: active, drinking, improv, team, word and stupid. Some games are old standards (but with a new twist), while others are little known. Whether it be a pregame, vision quest or full-blown mass cult suicide - there's a game here to suit every get-together!

From the creators of the game, "DRUNK STONED OR STUPID," games are customizable to play with or without drinking.

Don't let this little box fool you...it's stuffed with tons of interesting trivia questions that'll have you thinking, laughing, and wracking your brains! Juicy little tidbits of useless knowledge!

Put on your smarty pants and have a ball! Play for hours and collect 'em all!

This cute little box contains a game board, 4 pawns, a die, 500 questions on cards, rules, and unquantifiable fun. Seriously.

—description from the box

Put on your smarty pans and have a ball! Play for hours & collect 'em all!

This cute little box contains a game board, 4 pawns, a die, 500 questions on cards, rules, and unquantifiable fun. Seriously.

—description from the box

Help the Critters find all the hidden objects to decorate the house before the guest of honor arrives. The 3-dimensional game board features 4 Calico Critter rooms.

As you travel the game board with your Critter, you'll look for the 5 things which belong in your room. You'll need a good memory and a bit of luck to succeed. If you get your room totally decorated first, before your opponents' AND before the birthday girl arrives--Surprise! You win!

—description from the publisher

Black Hole is a light, roll and move game where players have to race to the end before the Black Hole consumes them. A simple game is made difficult by rocket cards that can help and asteroid cards that can hurt you and the other players. This is a game that everyone can win, and everyone can lose. Will you try to win on your own, or play as a team to get everyone out alive?

—description from the designer

Unmask! is a simple colorful, set collection, hidden role, press your luck game in which your goal is to collect the most victory points. You gain points by expanding your card collection through your "investigations".

Set in the Victorian Era, you take the role of one of the detectives whose job is to find the culprit behind a heist of the noble treasure by gathering information from the witnesses attending the grand event while the villain is lurking about trying to block all your efforts. In this small card game, you will be given the chance to unmask each other in order to nullify an opponent's special bonus through careful deduction before the game ends.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
As each new card is turned up, be careful to observe the number of animals, because depending on whether it is odd or even, you’ll need to imitate a different animal call. Be careful you don’t end up having kittens!
—description from the publisher

À chaque carte retournée, attention de bien observer le nombre d’animaux car pair ou impair, l’animal à imiter ne sera pas le même… De quoi devenir complètement chèvre !
—description from the publisher (French)

How can you keep from going crazy when you have to either catch the animal that's represented or the one that isn't?? A game of deduction and speed for the very young.
—description from the publisher

Comment ne pas perdre la tête quand il faut, soit attraper l'animal représenté, soit celui qui ne l'est pas ? Un jeu de déduction et de rapidité pour les plus jeunes.
—description from the publisher (French)

A new kids’ version of the famous game of Yahtzee, by Djeco: three rolls of the dice to get the best combination of animals in three-of-a-kind, families, four-of-a-kind, and, best of all, yahtzee – just like in the grown-ups’ game!
—description from the publisher

Le célèbre jeu du Yam revisité par Djeco pour le plus petits : sur les dés des animaux à regrouper en 3 lancers pour former des brelans, des familles, des carrés et surtout le yams comme les grands !
—description from the publisher (French)

Year Five Collector's Edition!

Use Insight to access the Dreamscape that contains powerful Heroes, Constructs and Visions. Then, take part in the War of Shadows to harness the power of Night and Day.

The Year Five Collector's Edition includes the base set of Ascension, Dreamscape and War of Shadows expansions, and all promo cards released throughout Ascension's fifth year.

All cards and game board are treated in premium foil, and this unique Collector's Edition comes with a special token pouch to hold 100 game tokens. The game is packed in a full-color tin but also comes with a travel box and dividers for portability and organization.

item.description:
Hurray, your company just got a lucrative job: build a road between two cities.
But the computer managing the production line just went bananas and random building material comes out of the factory.

You already heard this story? Yes, but now it is multiplayer!

Going Further is a fast tile laying game for 1 to 4 players.

Each player build his own road by joining tiles picked from a common set called "Tile Factory". 
The tiles in the Tile Factory are visible to all players. 
Beware that not all the tiles in the Tile Factory are immediately available to be played. Some of them can be unlocked only after other tiles have been selected and connected to a road. So, be fast to get to that valuable tile faster than your opponents!

The game ends when no more playable tiles are available.

Each player shall choose the best strategy to unlock new tiles while scoring as many points as possible and, at the same time, preventing the opponents to do the same.. 
In fact, each tile grants a different number of points; the total score consists of the sum of each individual tile points.
Additional points can be added or removed from the total, depending on the achieved road final configuration.

In particular, watch out for road loops and famous landmarks!

—description from the publisher

Welcome to the Multiverse!

Even in blackest day and darkest night, when all odds are stacked against them by super villains, interstellar invaders, crazed despots and maniacal anarchists, the world's finest heroes assemble to face the threat. Now, with the DC Universe Miniature Game, the stories of these epic battles between superhumans, gods and monsters is at Your fingertips...

In the DC Universe Miniature Game, You and Your friends collect a set of beautiful miniatures of your favourite DC heroes and villains, bring them to life by painting them, and then using them as playing pieces in an exciting multi-faceted, three dimensional tactical game. Every model in the DC Universe Miniature Games is supplied with a character card, which tracks a model's actions and health during a game. Most importantly, the character card keeps track of a model's Power Counters, which are used to fuel powers and abilities, from flight and teleportation, to heat vision and magical spells.

Picking models to battle in the DC Universe Miniature Game is really easy, and the game is designed to offer total flexibility in how You assemble Your teams. Firstly You need to decide if Your team is predominantly Heroes or Villains. You can choose any model of the same 'alignment' to join Your team. Some models have a Neutral alignment, which means the can join either team.

The game is scenario based, although You can play a simple deathmatch just for fun.

Sequence of Play

Each Round is broken down into four distinct phases, which proceed in the following order:


 Power Phase: Players distribute Power counters to each of the models in their team, usually up to the character’s Power value. If a character is KO, Power counters are instead generated.
 Initiative Phase: Players determine the order in which they will proceed through the round. This stage adds a level of unpredictability to the game – you might go first this round, but end up going last in the next.
 Action Phase: The players activate each character in turn – moving, fighting, shooting, and resolving special actions. Play alternates, with the player who went first activating a single model, then the second player activates a model, and so on, until all models that can act have done so.
 Final Phase: Some special effects must also be resolved in this phase. This is also a ‘tidying up’ phase, where Power counters are removed and scenario victory conditions are checked. If, at the end of the Final Phase, one player’s entire crew is Knocked Out and/or has been removed from play, the game ends and the other player is declared the victor.


Every test/combat (To Hit, Agility etc.) is resolved by rolling dice, usually 2d8.

Warhammer Underworlds: Nightvault is an action-packed combat game for two players. Build your warband, construct your deck, and defeat your rivals.

Shadespire was once a city of wonder and magic, a mercantile metropolis whose rulers defied death, to the fury of Nagash. During the height of the city’s powers, rivals, thieves and would-be conquerors were locked away in the sprawling dungeon known as the Nightvault. After the city’s fall, Nagash broke open the chains that bound the shackled spirits within, giving them weapons to freeze the hearts of the living and enough memory of their torment to fill them with hatred and jealousy. The spectral dead delight in the chance to inflict this hatred upon the living, and the streets of Shadespire echo to the sounds of terrifying screams and cruel, mocking laughter...

The Game

In Warhammer Underworlds, you and your opponent pick a warband – 2 are included in this box – and build a deck of power and objective cards. After placing your warband on the hex-tiled game boards, you take turns making actions – movement and attacks – until 3 phases are played. Between actions, you can use the power cards to introduce effects and reactions that can swing the battle in your favour; building the best deck you can and using cunning to deploy these abilities at the perfect time is the secret to mastering the game and dominating your foe. Merely vanquishing your opponent’s warband does not guarantee victory – capturing objectives, standing your ground, making the best tactical choices and deploying the right cards at the right time will gain you the glory points you need to win!

Once you’re familiar with the rules, games will take around 30 minutes – you’ll always have time for a rematch.

In The Box

Everything you and a friend need to play games of Warhammer Underworlds is included in this box. Contained within:


 A Stormcast Eternals warband – Stormsire’s Cursebreakers – made up of 3 push-fit, blue plastic miniatures (Rastus the Charmed, Ammis Dawnguard and the leader, Averon Stormsire);
 A Nighthaunt warband – the Thorns of the Briarqueen – made up of 7 push-fit, bone-coloured plastic miniatures (The Ever-Hanged, Varclav the Cruel, the leader Briar Queen and 4 Chainrasps whom Nagash has not afforded the dignity of names). Both of these warbands are Easy To Build, with no glue necessary and a comprehensive, easy to follow construction guide;
 A 32-page rulebook, including the story of Shadespire’s rise and fall, the opening of the Nightvault, the background of the 2 included warbands and all the rules you need to play – including new scatter mechanics, rules for resolving magic spells, and the use of lethal hexes, sections of game board that are fatal to those pushed in;
 An 8-page quick start guide, covering the contents of the box, understanding your cards, movement and attacks, and playing your first game;
 2 double-sided game boards, featuring hexes and objectives;
 2 pre-built decks of power and objective cards – 96 in total – for use with the included warbands;
 10 double-sided Fighter cards, providing the stats and information needed for the fighters in each warband at a glance;
 5 attack dice, 3 defence dice and 3 magic dice;
 11 double-sided objective tokens;
 A scatter template;
 30 wound tokens;
 46 double-sided glory point tokens;
 15 double-sided move and charge tokens;
 15 Guard tokens;
 8 activation counters.


Extra Rules

Warhammer Underworlds has an intense, fast and fun core ruleset, but the book contains a host of extras - new game modes, competitive and multiplayer rules:


 Matched Play: designed for competitive play, this is a set of rules that level the playing field to the finest degree – perfect for fast, friendly rivalries and tournaments;
 Multiplayer games: extra rules that allow you to combine 2 core sets of Warhammer Underworlds to create 3-or-4-player games, with clarified rules for resolving attacks and adjustments to victory conditions.


Also included is a glossary for quick and easy reference and a sample chapter of The Mirrored City, a Black Library novel set in Shadespire.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
This is simple competitive sci-fi game for 1-4 players. You're trying to escape your home planet and get to a new planet. It's a fast paced game, where the tables can turn any minute. You can help or sabotage another player, outfit your ship with the best ship parts you can, enhance the performance your shield or weapons or engine with performance enhancers. Play with the included events expansion to add some variety to your game.

The solar system is dying. The twin suns are imploding and the resulting vacuum is sucking all planets towards them which will eradicate all life. There are four inhabited planets in your solar system, all at odds with one another. Thankfully you found a habitable planet 14 parsecs away that will allow your race to thrive once more. Unfortunately, the rest of the planets in the solar system have discovered this new home world as well. This new world will only allow one race to live there in peace. It’s your duty with your intrepid crew to bring several hundred pioneers, frozen in stasis, to this new home world to restart your civilization. It’s the ultimate race with only one surviving species.

—description from the designer

Don't let anyone else lift the cup!

FootClub is a card game with a tactical dimension in which you control everything: recruitment during the transfer window, team lineup, pre-match strategy and coaching during the game.

Footclub offers a total immersion into the football experience, including the thrill and emotions of a real football match!

FootClub Ligue is a standalone extension of FootClub, which has the particularity of containing more components than the base box.

Stand alone: the box contains a complete set for 2 players, with 2 game modes available. Pee Wee mode (15 min): simple, accessible for all, perfect to discover the game, it will easily attract beginners as well as young players. Expert mode (60 min): strategically rich and with great replay value, it will satisfy experienced players.

Extension: by combining with the FootClub box, discover the League mode for 4 players. This is how FootClub reveals its true dimension.
Manage your recruitment budget in a "tight" transfer window, based on auctions.

Receive transfer offers. Will you withdraw a player despite a great offer?

Focus on your training centre: a young player can progress in a dazzling way to become a superstar!

Do you prefer short game sessions? It's simple and quick with the backup form.

Many new features and optional rules: new Match cards, new player positions, strengths of the goalkeepers, match on neutral ground.
Official rule of the Solo mode available for free download.

—description from the designer

Be unanimous on 6 words!
A card is placed in the centre of the table. At that moment, each player writes words on his notepad which are inspired by the theme. Let your inspiration guide you… But be careful, whatever you do, don’t be original. The only answers which count are the ones which are the same as the other players!

item.description:
Το ΒλÎ­μμα Της ΑγελÎ¬δας ("Cow's Look") is a game for 2 or more players played with a standard set of playing cards and three special dice. Each player rolls the dice and selects his actions aiming to be the first one to get rid of all his cards.

Each round ends as soon as one player discards his last card and then all other players score their hands. When someone reaches 150 points the game is over and the player with the least amount of points wins.

name.value: Warfighter: The Modern Night Combat Card Game – Shadow War

item.description:
Warfighter: Shadow War is a card game for 1 to 6 players. You play cooperatively with your friends against the system to complete Modern Special Forces squad-level combat missions. At the start of each mission, you each select a soldier, equip him/her with skills, weapons, and combat gear within the mission's Resource limit.

Shadow War is a stand-alone Warfighter boxed game. The game includes all the Soldiers, Weapons, Equipment, Missions, Location, Objectives, and Hostiles you need to carryout covert Night Missions. Shadow War expands on the Night Combat rules first introduced in the Warfighter Modern Footlocker Expansion.

The core game gives you a full team of US Soldiers and a full set of North Korean Hostiles. Each Expansion then adds to these sets.

As with all Warfighter games and expansions, Shadow War is compatible with all the other Warfighter games!

—description from the publisher

item.description:
In Le Dernier Casse, you're trying to crack into opponents' safes and steal their ingots before they can get into yours.

Each player starts the game with three safes (i.e. three screens), a number of gold ingots that they secretly distribute within their safes, and three secret code numbers on cards. They look at the numbers, then place one under each safe to represent its combination.

At the start of the round, the active player reveals one more number card than the number of players. Each player in turn gives one of these cards to their left or right neighbor. The person receiving the card places it to the right of all their safes if the number on the card matches one of their combinations; otherwise this player places the card in front of one of their safes if the card is higher than that safe's combination and behind the safe if it's lower.

After everyone has finished the first phase, each player can attempt to guess the value of an opponent's combination. They must ante some gold, then identify a safe and a number. If they're wrong, the owner of the safe keeps their ante; if they're right, then the safe owner hands over all the gold in that safe to the active player. If all your safes have been cracked, you're out of the game!

Game Intro. "Let’s face it. You don’t really want to be here. You don’t really want to talk to any of these people. You don’t really even want to play this game. But you came here for a reason, and you’re not going to get it unless you’re prepared to engage in a little small talk, the occasional social lubricant, and some generous nodding and smiling. If you play your cards right—literally in this case—you might just walk out of here a new person... yeah, who are we kidding, you’ll just be happy if you get through the evening with your dignity intact."

Awkward Party is a thematic card game, with party game elements, that pokes fun at the bizarre traditions and anxieties that define awkward social gatherings. At the start of the game, each player receives a hand of seven Awkward Party cards (hand limit 7), three Why Am I Even Here? Cards (hand limit), and sets their individual Awkwardness meter to 5. The Party Interest meter is put in the middle of the table and also set to 5. The Awkward Party cards are the main cards that the players play throughout the game with varying effects. They come in a number of categories such as Conversation, Venue, Money, Role, Drink, Support, Romantic Encounter, Rejection, and Something Interesting. The Conversation cards also have their own subjects such as Weather, Movies, Sports, Religion, Politics, and Sex.

The Why Am I Even Here? cards are the secret objectives each player is trying to complete. They also vary considerably from having a Conversation with all other players to receiving Money from two other players to acquiring the "Someone's Dog" card. Once one of their objectives has been completed, the player must reveal the corresponding Why Am I Even Here? card. In most cases, the winner of the game is the player who has revealed the most Why Am I Even Here? cards. There are a few exceptions such as the "Go Home" and the "Street Cred" Why Am I Even Here? cards, which are only completed and revealed when a particular game-ending event is triggered, even if it is not on the player's turn. If the event is triggered, the player holding the corresponding Why Am I Even Here? card wins the game regardless of how many revealed Why Am I Even Here? cards other players have. The game ends immediately when any one of the following events occurs:

 A player reveals three completed Why Am I Even Here? cards. 
 A player's Awkwardness meter exceeds 10 (and they are forced to leave the party).
 Party Interest drops below 1.
 Party Interest exceeds 10 for the third time and the cops arrive to shut it down.




Game-play itself is turn-based. Each player turn has four phases: 

 Play 0-2 Awkward Party cards. 
 Discard any number of Awkward Party and/or unrevealed Why Am I Even Here? cards. 
 Draw Awkward Party and/or Why Am I Even Here? cards up to the hand limit (revealed Why Am I Even Here? cards still count).
 Reduce Party Interest by 1.




If a player plays a conversation card on another player, any player may play another card to join the conversation if their awkwardness is low enough and they have a matching subject. With the exception of Conversation, Rejection, Money, and Support cards, turns can be stolen by other players by playing a card in the same category as the card just played. This card counts as the first card played by the player that just stole the turn. Turn-stealing can be chained, one card at a time, so long as players continue playing cards from the same category.

—description from the designer

Shard Slingers is a fast-paced, push your luck, card and dice game about a handful of sorcerers competing to cast the biggest and best spells they can, in order to amaze an arena of spectators. 
Players use 8-sided elemental dice, called Shards, to match up to similar elemental requirement icons on the spell cards.

—description from the designer
